verses.text: Now after these things, in the reign of Artaxerxes king of Persia, Ezra the son of Seraiah, the son of Azariah, the son of Hilkiah,
the son of Shallum, the son of Zadok, the son of Ahitub,
the son of Amariah, the son of Azariah, the son of Meraioth,
the son of Zerahiah, the son of Uzzi, the son of Bukki,
the son of Abishua, the son of Phinehas, the son of Eleazar, the son of Aaron the chief priest:

this Ezra went up from Babylon; and he \add was\add* a ready scribe in the law of Moses, which the \sc Lord\sc* God of Israel had given: and the king granted him all his request, according to the hand of the \sc Lord\sc* his God upon him.

And there went up \add some\add* of the children of Israel, and of the priests, and the Levites, and the singers, and the porters, and the Nethinims, unto Jerusalem, in the seventh year of Artaxerxes the king.
And he came \add to\add* Jerusalem in the fifth month, which \add was in\add* the seventh year of the king.

For upon the first \add day\add* of the first month began he to go up from Babylon, and on the first \add day\add* of the fifth month came he to Jerusalem, according to the good hand of his God upon him.
For Ezra had prepared his heart to seek the law of the \sc Lord\sc*, and to do \add it\add*, and to teach in Israel statutes and judgments.

Now this \add is\add* the copy of the letter that the king Artaxerxes gave unto Ezra the priest, the scribe, \add even\add* a scribe of the words of the commandments of the \sc Lord\sc*, and of his statutes to Israel.
Artaxerxes, king of kings, unto Ezra the priest, a scribe of the law of the God of heaven, perfect \add peace\add*, and at such a time.

I make a decree, that all they of the people of Israel, and \add of\add* his priests and Levites, in my realm, \add which are\add* minded of their own freewill to go \add up\add* to Jerusalem, go with thee.
Forasmuch as \add thou art\add* sent of the king, and of his seven counsellers, to inquire concerning Judah and Jerusalem, according to the law of thy God which \add is\add* in thine hand;
and to carry the silver and gold, which the king and his counsellers have freely offered unto the God of Israel, whose habitation \add is\add* in Jerusalem,

and all the silver and gold that thou canst find in all the province of Babylon, with the freewill offering of the people, and of the priests, offering willingly for the house of their God which \add is\add* in Jerusalem:

that thou mayest buy speedily with this money bullocks, rams, lambs, with their meat offerings and their drink offerings, and offer them upon the altar of the house of your God which \add is\add* in Jerusalem.
And whatsoever shall seem good to thee, and to thy brethren, to do with the rest of the silver and gold, \add that\add* do after the will of your God.
The vessels also that \add are\add* given thee for the service of the house of thy God, \add those\add* deliver thou before the God of Jerusalem.
And whatsoever more \add shall be\add* needful for the house of thy God, which thou shalt have occasion to bestow, bestow \add it\add* out of the king’s treasure house.

And I, \add even\add* I Artaxerxes the king, do make a decree to all the treasurers which \add are\add* beyond the river, that whatsoever Ezra the priest, the scribe of the law of the God of heaven, shall require of you, \add it\add* be done speedily,

unto an hundred talents \add of\add* silver, and to an hundred measures \add of\add* wheat, and to an hundred baths \add of\add* wine, and to an hundred baths \add of\add* oil, and salt without prescribing \add how much\add*.
Whatsoever \add is\add* commanded by the God of heaven, let it be diligently done for the house of the God of heaven: for why should there be wrath against the realm of the king and his sons?

Also \add we\add* certify you, that \add touching\add* any of the priests and Levites, singers, porters, Nethinims, or ministers of this house of God, it \add shall\add* not \add be\add* lawful to impose toll, tribute, or custom, upon them.

And thou, Ezra, after the wisdom of thy God, that \add is\add* in thine hand, set magistrates and judges, which may judge all the people that \add are\add* beyond the river, all such as know the laws of thy God; and teach ye them that know \add them\add* not.

And whosoever will not do the law of thy God, and the law of the king, let judgment be executed speedily upon him, whether \add it be\add* unto death, or to banishment, or to confiscation of goods, or to imprisonment.
Blessed \add be\add* the \sc Lord\sc* God of our fathers, which hath put \add such a thing\add* as this in the king’s heart, to beautify the house of the \sc Lord\sc* which \add is\add* in Jerusalem:

and hath extended mercy unto me before the king, and his counsellers, and before all the king’s mighty princes. And I was strengthened as the hand of the \sc Lord\sc* my God \add was\add* upon me, and I gathered together out of Israel chief \add men\add* to go up with me.
